p: As with any study involving GCMs, our results are subject to limitations related to the accuracy of modeled atmosphericâ€“ocean dynamics, which drive the behavior and tracks of downscaled TCs. Of particular relevance is the limited skill of CMIP5 models in simulating the Atlantic meridional overturning circulation (AMOC) and Arctic sea ice loss ( 37, 38). Although CMIP5 models generally project a weakening of the AMOC by 2100, the degree of weakening varies greatly across individual models ( 37). In addition, although GCMs continue to improve their representation of Arctic sea ice loss, most CMIP5 models still underestimate observed trends ( 38). Biases in projections of both phenomena may impact TC trajectories.
